title: Advanced Automated Environment Management at a Large Multi-User Shared Facility
content: The Center for Nanoscale Systems (CNS) at Harvard University is a shared-use core facility that provides a collaborative multi-disciplinary research environment for the study, design, and fabrication of nanoscale structures and their integration into large and complex interacting systems. The CNS supports a wide range of nanoscience and engineering applications, from cleanroom fabrication to the characterization of nanoscale devices and structures, to electron-beam imaging and analysis tools, to materials characterization and soft lithography. The CNS also offers training, education, and outreach programs for researchers from academia and industry, as well as the public.
